# Description
Currently, running pwsh via Exec resource from puppet. Manifests are located [https://github.com/Condoamanti/pwsh_bug]. Basically the command gets executed to install the module given, in this case 'Posh-SSH' but it fails to wait for completion even though, -NoExit, is defined. Looking for validation if this is a powershell issue on how it is executing the 'Install-Module' within linux environment, or if it is a puppet wait/command utilization issue.

# Steps to reproduce

```shell
mkdir /tmp/scripts/;
echo "pwsh -NoExit -Command \"Find-Module -Name \"Posh-SSH\" -Repository \"PSGallery\" | Install-Module -Force 2>&1; Do{Start-Sleep -Second 1}While(\\\$(Get-Module -Name \"Posh-SSH\" -ListAvailable).Name.Count -lt 1)\"" > powershell_module_install-Posh-SSH-PSGallery.sh > /tmp/scripts/powershell_module_install-Posh-SSH-PSGallery.sh;
chmod 744 /tmp/scripts/powershell_module_install-Posh-SSH-PSGallery.sh;
bash ./powershell_module_install-Posh-SSH-PSGallery.sh;
```
# Expected behavior

```none
Should install 'Posh-SSH' module and exit
```

# Actual behavior

```none
Runs the 'Install-Module' command but exits prematurely, which causes no installation to complete.
```
